abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Treasury Development
            Project for Russian Federation were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory; risk to development outcome was low or
            negligible; Bank performance was satisfactory and borrower
            performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            includes: client ownership and strong strategic leadership
            on the beneficiary side is a key to success of institutional
            development projects. Continuity of the core team working on
            the project, both from the Bank side and the government
            side, is very important for the success of a project. While
            designing the project, wider involvement of counterparts
            involved in management of public finances should be ensured
            in order to explore various available options for a good
            project. It is essential to pay close attention at the
            design stage to the political economy context of the
            country. Simple design and focus on the core functionality
            of the treasury system are highly appropriate for initial
            stage of implementation of public Financial Management
            Information Systems (FMIS). Frequent changes in legislation
            will adversely affect the momentum of implementation of any
            project that supports automation of procedures derived from
            that legislation. Very close monitoring of procurement
            process by the project team and quick reaction to each
            potential problem or bottleneck with finding appropriate and
            mutually acceptable solution, will work strongly for the
            smooth implementation of the project and its overall success.

repnme.cdata!:
Russian Federation - Treasury Development
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall objectives of the Treasury
            Development Project for the Russian Federation are to ensure
            conditions for effective implementation of the budget, and
            enable the finance ministry to maintain budget oversight;
            and provide a transparent system of accounting that shows
            the utilization of the financial resources of the Government
            and enables management and audit of these resources. The
            extension is necessary to complete the ongoing Treasury
            System (FTAS) roll-out in all 83 regions, including the
            largest regions/cities in the country, such as Moscow and
            St. Petersburg (the Bank's experience in similar
            projects in many other countries would help the Federal
            Treasury (FT) in overcoming challenges that are likely to
            come up in these specific implementations); and ensure the
            successful completion of ongoing/remaining contracts for
            FTAS implementation over the course of the next 18 months
            (with remaining commitments worth about $100m, the
            Bank's continued supervision of FTAS implementation
            will help ensure that the elements of the Information and
            Communication (ICT) infrastructure are implemented smoothly
            and FTAS becomes fully functional by project end). This will
            be the third extension of the closing date of the project.

display_title.display_title:
Russian Federation - Treasury
            Development Project : restructuring : Main report

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall objectives of the Treasury
            Development Project for the Russian Federation are to 1)
            ensure conditions for effective implmentation of the budget,
            and enable the finance ministry to maintain budget
            oversight; and 2) provide a transparent system of accounting
            that shows the utilization of the financial resoures of the
            Government and enables management and audit of these
            resources. There are four project components. The first
            component supplements the consulting/advisory services
            concerning budget execution supported by the International
            monetary Fund with technical assistance in these functional
            and technical areas: budget classifications and coding
            structures, and development and design of a revised
            structure and chart of accounts; development of the legal,
            regulatory, and operational framework and detailed
            guidelines, procedures, regulations, forms, and operating
            manuals; developing methods to improve forescasting of
            expenditure requirements and cash management; developing
            technology architecture; researching and identifying
            aplication software; and supervising implementation of the
            budget execution. The second component finances equipment
            and software. The third component supports the training
            requirements. The fourth and final component assists the
            Treasury with administering and managing the project and
            includes funding to over incremental operating expenses.
